laboratory_examinations.findings: 410 mg/dL (22.8 mmol/L), poorly controlled diabetes mellitus.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood sugar was controlled with insulin, leading to a steady correction of glycemia in the subsequent days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Faint and homogeneous hyperattenuation of the left lentiform nucleus.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT two months later showed the absence of abnormal findings.

laboratory_examinations.date: 2 days after the onset of hemiballism-hemichorea
laboratory_examinations.findings: Abnormal strong hyperintense signal in the posterior portion of the left putamen on T1-weighted images and isointensity on T2-weighted images.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI showed normal signal intensity in the left putamen after intervention.
